chapter.title: Preface
chapter.para: The Oracle Fusion Middleware Developer's Guide for Oracle Identity Governance describes how to develop and customize various components and features of Oracle Identity Governance.

section.title: Audience
section.para: This guide is intended for developers who use Oracle Identity Governance development tools to customize the product according to the requirements of an organization. The customization involves using APIs, configuring request datasets and approval workflows, developing connectors by using Adapter Factory, and customizing the user interface.

section.title: Confidentiality
section.para: The material contained in this documentation represents proprietary, confidential information pertaining to Oracle products and methods.

The audience agrees that the information in this documentation shall not be disclosed outside of Oracle, and shall not be duplicated, used, or disclosed for any purpose other than to evaluate this procedure.

section.title: Typographical Conventions
section.para: The following text conventions are used in this document.

row.entry: Boldface type indicates graphical user interface elements associated with an action, or terms defined in text or the glossary.
Italic type indicates book titles, emphasis, or placeholder variables for which you supply particular values.
Monospace type indicates commands within a paragraph, URLs, code in examples, text that appears on the screen, or text that you enter.
A link to another section of the document or to an external document or website.

section.title: Conventions Directory Variables
section.para: The following table explains variables that might be used in this document.

row.entry: The location where the supported Java Development Kit (JDK) was installed.
The base directory where Oracle products are installed.
The location for a product's binaries. For the application tier host computers, it should be stored on a shared disk.

section.title: Symbol Conventions
section.para: The following table explains symbols that might be used in this document.

row.entry: Contains optional arguments and command options.
Contains a set of choices for a required command option.
Indicates menu item selection in a graphical user interface.

section.para: For information about installing and using Oracle Identity and Access Management, visit the following Oracle Help Center pages:
